camel.source.path.clusterName.name: camel.source.path.clusterName
camel.source.path.clusterName.description: The name of the JGroupsraft cluster the component should connect to.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.enableRoleChangeEv.name: camel.source.endpoint.enableRoleChangeEvents
camel.source.endpoint.enableRoleChangeEv.description: If set to true, the consumer endpoint will receive roleChange event as well (not just connecting and/or using the state machine). By default it is set to false.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.component.jgroups-raft.channelProp.name: camel.component.jgroups-raft.channelProperties
camel.component.jgroups-raft.channelProp.description: Specifies configuration properties of the RaftHandle JChannel used by the endpoint (ignored if raftHandle ref is provided).

camel.component.jgroups-raft.bridgeError.name: camel.component.jgroups-raft.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.jgroups-raft.bridgeError.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.jgroups-raft.autowiredEn.name: camel.component.jgroups-raft.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.jgroups-raft.autowiredEn.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
